main event: A bright, round, white object was observed hovering and fading out instantaneously to the west in Lincoln, Nebraska on December 11, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as being somewhat smaller than a full moon and very brilliant.
The object appeared to hover and then fade out instantaneously to the west.
The observer was a reliable, rated Air Force navigator.
Meteors were observed by the Lincoln AFB control tower on the night of December 9, 1958, which the preparing officer believes may have been the object sighted.
